definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: She teaches deaf children to lip-read.
sentences.chinese: 她教耳聾兒童運用脣讀法。

sentences.english: The deaf man has learned to LIP-read a large vocabulary of words.
sentences.chinese: 那個聾人已學會用脣讀法瞭解許多詞。

sentences.english: Keep in mind the pronunciation of ancient characters with entering tone in putonghua.
sentences.chinese: 記住古入聲字在普通話中的讀法。

sentences.english: This is a kind of habit and fixed pronunciation.
sentences.chinese: 這是一種習慣而又固定的讀法。

sentences.english: Now practice the pronunciation of the new words together.
sentences.chinese: 我們一起來練習這個詞的讀法。

sentences.english: This paper puts foward a new system for translation of mathematical symbol and formula into Tibetan.
sentences.chinese: 本文提出了一個數學符號和式子藏文讀法的翻譯方案。

sentences.english: Some Hebrew letters have two pronunciations.
sentences.chinese: 有些希伯萊字母有兩種讀法。

definition: reading or phonetic value of a character
tone/note/a tone (on a Chinese syllable)/CL:個|个[ge4]
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
the four tones of Middle Chinese: level tone 平聲|平声, rising tone 上聲|上声, departing tone 去聲|去声 and entering tone 入聲|入声/the four tones of Modern Standard Mandarin
